analyzer package¶

Submodules¶

analyzer.analyzer module¶

class analyzer.analyzer.Analyzer¶

Bases: object

Cuckoo Windows Analyzer.

This class handles the initialization and execution of the analysis procedure, including handling of the pipe server, the auxiliary modules and the analysis packages.

complete()¶

End analysis.

get_pipe_path(name)¶

Return .PIPE on Windows XP and ??PIPE elsewhere.

prepare()¶

Prepare env for analysis.

run()¶

Run analysis. @return: operation status.

stop()¶

Allow an auxiliary module to stop the analysis.

class analyzer.analyzer.CommandPipeHandler(analyzer)¶

Bases: object

Pipe Handler.

This class handles the notifications received through the Pipe Server and decides what to do with them.

dispatch(data)¶
ignore_list = {'pid': []}¶
class analyzer.analyzer.Files¶

Bases: object

PROTECTED_NAMES = ()¶
add_file(filepath, pid=None)¶

Add filepath to the list of files and track the pid.

add_pid(filepath, pid, verbose=True)¶

Track a process identifier for this file.

delete_file(filepath, pid=None)¶

A file is about to removed and thus should be dumped right away.

dump_file(filepath)¶

Dump a file to the host.

dump_files()¶

Dump all pending files.

is_protected_filename(file_name)¶

Return whether or not to inject into a process with this name.

move_file(oldfilepath, newfilepath, pid=None)¶

A file will be moved - track this change.

class analyzer.analyzer.ProcessList¶

Bases: object

add_pid(pid, track=True)¶

Add a process identifier to the process list.

Track determines whether the analyzer should be monitoring this process, i.e., whether Cuckoo should wait for this process to finish.

add_pids(pids)¶

Add one or more process identifiers to the process list.

has_pid(pid, notrack=True)¶

Return whether or not this process identifier being tracked.

remove_pid(pid)¶

Remove a process identifier from being tracked.
